parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ETC system can cause the throttle to malfunction, leading to sudden acceleration or loss of throttle response, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The throttle goes to wide open position by itself
idle RPM increases to 1500 RPM (limp mode)
throttle only works in idle mode

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the TGS can cause the throttle to malfunction, leading to sudden acceleration or loss of throttle response, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Throttle only works in idle mode

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: ECM (Engine Control Module) or ATC Pin Connectors Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ECM or ATC pin connectors can cause the throttle to malfunction, leading to sudden acceleration or loss of throttle response, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: idle RPM increases to 1500 RPM (limp mode)

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS module can cause a sudden and complete loss of rear brake functionality, leading to a loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The rear brake pedal goes to the maximum limit without resistance
the rear brake fails to engage
the brake fluid is contaminated or incorrect.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The use of incorrect brake fluid can cause corrosion and damage to the ABS module, leading to a failure of the rear brake system and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: the brake fluid is contaminated or incorrect
the rear brake pedal goes to the maximum limit without resistance
the rear brake fails to engage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A defective wheel bearing can cause loud noises, vibrations, and potentially lead to loss of control, accidents, or wheel failure, which can result in serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Loud noise coming from the bottom of the vehicle

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The rear end oscillation can cause a loss of control, accidents, or rollover, which can result in serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: especially when traveling at high speeds (50-70 mph) on long sweeping turns.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the electronic throttle control can cause the motorcycle to decelerate or accelerate abnormally, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing accidents or injuries.
symptoms: the motorcycle accelerates rapidly without input from the rider
the cruise control fails to maintain the set speed
the check engine light illuminates on the speedometer.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the primary case bolt can cause the vehicle to stop running, leading to a loss of control and potentially resulting in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: A banging noise coming from the primary case
the bolt that holds the compensation brackets in the primary case comes out.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front cylinder head gasket can cause oil leaks, leading to engine damage, overheating, and potentially resulting in accidents or injuries.
